intro: Clidemia semijuga, commonly known as the false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
